Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "erde"

Afar

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /erˈde/ [ʔɛɾˈdɛ]
  • Hyphenation: er‧de

Verb

[edit]

erdé (causative eyreddé, frequentative eramerdé)

  1. (intransitive) run

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of erde (type I verb)
1st singular 2nd singular 3rd singular 1st plural 2nd plural 3rd plural
m f
perfective V-affirmative erdéh terdéh yerdéh terdéh nerdéh terdeeníh yerdeeníh
N-affirmative erdé terdé yerdé terdé nerdé terdén yerdén
negative máardinniyo máardinnito máardinna máardinna máardinnino máardinniton máardinnon
imperfective V-affirmative ardéh tardéh yardéh tardéh nardéh tardeeníh yardeeníh
N-affirmative ardé tardé yardé tardé nardé tardén yardén
negative máarda mátarda máyarda,
míyarda		 mátarda mánarda mátardan máyardan,
míyardan

ardéyyoh		 ardélitoh,
ardéttoh		 ardéleh ardéleh ardélinoh,

References

[edit]
  • E. M. Parker; R. J. Hayward (1985), “erde”, in An Afar-English-French dictionary (with Grammatical Notes in English), University of London, →ISBN
  • Mohamed Hassan Kamil (2015), L’afar: description grammaticale d’une langue couchitique (Djibouti, Erythrée et Ethiopie)‎[1], Paris: Université Sorbonne Paris Cité (doctoral thesis)

German

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

erde

  1. inflection of erden:
    1. first-person singular present
    2. singular imperative
    3. first/third-person singular subjunctive I

Middle Dutch

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Dutch ertha, from Proto-Germanic *erþō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈɛrdə/

Noun

[edit]

erde f

  1. the Earth
  2. soil, ground

Inflection

[edit]
Weak feminine noun
singular plural
nominative erde —
accusative erde —
genitive erde, erden —
dative erde, erden —

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • āerde
  • ēerde

Descendants

[edit]
  • Dutch: aarde, aard
    • Afrikaans: aarde
    • Negerhollands: aarde, adu, aerde
      • → Virgin Islands Creole: adu, ard (archaic)
    • → Indonesian: arde
  • Limburgish: aerd, aerj

Further reading

[edit]
  • “erde”, in Vroegmiddelnederlands Woordenboek, 2000
  • Verwijs, E.; Verdam, J. (1885–1929), “erde”, in Middelnederlandsch Woordenboek, The Hague: Martinus Nijhoff, →ISBN

Middle English

[edit]

Etymology 1

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

erde

  1. alternative form of erthe

Etymology 2

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

erde

  1. alternative form of erd

Middle High German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old High German ërda, from Proto-West Germanic *erþu.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (before 13th CE) /ˈɛrdə/

Noun

[edit]

ërde f

  1. earth

Declension

[edit]
Declension of ërde (weak feminine)
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein diu ërde die ërden
genitive einer dër ërden dër ërden
dative einer dër ërden dën ërden
accusative eine die ërden die ërden
Declension of ërde (strong feminine in -e)
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein diu ërde die ërde
genitive einer dër ërde dër ërden
dative einer dër ërde dën ërden
accusative eine die ërde die ërde

Descendants

[edit]
  • Alemannic German: Ëërde
  • Bavarian: Erd, Erdn
    Cimbrian: èerda
  • Central Franconian: Ääd, Erd (Moselle Franconian), Äerd
    Hunsrik: Äerd
    Kölsch: Äd
  • German: Erde
  • Luxembourgish: Äerd
  • Rhine Franconian: Erd
    Pennsylvania German: Erd, Aerd, Eaht
  • Vilamovian: aod
  • Yiddish: ערד (erd)

References

[edit]
  • Benecke, Georg Friedrich; Müller, Wilhelm; Zarncke, Friedrich (1863), “ërde”, in Mittelhochdeutsches Wörterbuch: mit Benutzung des Nachlasses von Benecke, Stuttgart: S. Hirzel

Turkish

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

erde

  1. locative singular of er
